connector.description: Perform operations on Kubernetes Deployments and get notified on Deployment changes.

camel.source.endpoint.apiVersion.name: camel.source.endpoint.apiVersion
camel.source.endpoint.apiVersion.description: The Kubernetes API Version to use

camel.source.endpoint.dnsDomain.name: camel.source.endpoint.dnsDomain
camel.source.endpoint.dnsDomain.description: The dns domain, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.source.endpoint.kubernetesClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.kubernetesClient
camel.source.endpoint.kubernetesClient.description: Default KubernetesClient to use if provided

camel.source.endpoint.portName.name: camel.source.endpoint.portName
camel.source.endpoint.portName.description: The port name, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.source.endpoint.portProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.portProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.portProtocol.description: The port protocol, used for ServiceCall EIP

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.crdGroup.name: camel.source.endpoint.crdGroup
camel.source.endpoint.crdGroup.description: The Consumer CRD Resource Group we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.crdName.name: camel.source.endpoint.crdName
camel.source.endpoint.crdName.description: The Consumer CRD Resource name we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.crdPlural.name: camel.source.endpoint.crdPlural
camel.source.endpoint.crdPlural.description: The Consumer CRD Resource Plural we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.crdScope.name: camel.source.endpoint.crdScope
camel.source.endpoint.crdScope.description: The Consumer CRD Resource Scope we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.crdVersion.name: camel.source.endpoint.crdVersion
camel.source.endpoint.crdVersion.description: The Consumer CRD Resource Version we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.labelKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.labelKey
camel.source.endpoint.labelKey.description: The Consumer Label key when watching at some resources

camel.source.endpoint.labelValue.name: camel.source.endpoint.labelValue
camel.source.endpoint.labelValue.description: The Consumer Label value when watching at some resources

camel.source.endpoint.resourceName.name: camel.source.endpoint.resourceName
camel.source.endpoint.resourceName.description: The Consumer Resource Name we would like to watch

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds to use when making requests to the Kubernetes API server.

camel.source.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo
camel.source.endpoint.clientKeyAlgo.description: The Key Algorithm used by the client

camel.source.endpoint.trustCerts.name: camel.source.endpoint.trustCerts
camel.source.endpoint.trustCerts.description: Define if the certs we used are trusted anyway or not

camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.b.name: camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.b.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.a.name: camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.kubernetes-deployments.a.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
